item.text: So Jacob went on his way and the angels of God met him.
When Jacob saw them, he exclaimed, “This is the camp of God!” So he named that place Mahanaim.
Jacob sent messengers on ahead to his brother Esau in the land of Seir, the region of Edom.

He <st data-num="06680 0559">commanded</st> them, “<st data-num="03541" class="">This is what</st> you must <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st> to my <st data-num="0113" class="">lord</st> <st data-num="06215" class="">Esau</st>: ‘<st data-num="03541" class="">This is what</st> your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">says</st>: I have been <st data-num="01481" class="">staying</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="03837" class="">Laban</st> <st data-num="0309 05704">until</st> <st data-num="06258" class="">now</st>.<n id="2" />
I have oxen, donkeys, sheep, and male and female servants. I have sent this message to inform my lord, so that I may find favor in your sight.’”
The messengers returned to Jacob and said, “We went to your brother Esau. He is coming to meet you and has 400 men with him.”

<st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> <st data-num="03372 03334">was</st> <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="03372" class="">afraid</st> and <st data-num="03334" class="">upset</st>. So he <st data-num="02673" class="">divided</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> were <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> him into <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="04264" class="">camps</st>, as well as the <st data-num="06629" class="">flocks</st>, <st data-num="01241" class="">herds</st>, and <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st>.
“If Esau attacks one camp,” he thought, “then the other camp will be able to escape.”
Then Jacob prayed, “O God of my father Abraham, God of my father Isaac, O Lord, you said to me, ‘Return to your land and to your relatives and I will make you prosper.’

I <st data-num="06994" class="">am not worthy</st> of <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0571" class="">faithful</st> <st data-num="02617" class="">love</st><n id="1" /> you have <st data-num="0834 06213 0854">shown</st><n id="2" /> your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st>. With only my <st data-num="03588 04731">walking stick</st><n id="3" /> I <st data-num="05674" class="">crossed</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">the</st> <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st>,<n id="4" /> but <st data-num="06258" class="">now</st> I have <st data-num="01961" class="">become</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="04264" class="">camps</st>.

<st data-num="05337" class="">Rescue</st> me,<n id="1" /> I <st data-num="04994" class="">pray</st>, from the <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st><n id="2" /> of my <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> <st data-num="06215" class="">Esau</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> am <st data-num="03373" class="">afraid</st> he will <st data-num="06435 0935">come</st><n id="4" /> and <st data-num="05221" class="">attack</st> me, as well as the <st data-num="0517" class="">mothers</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">with</st> their <st data-num="01121" class="">children</st>.<n id="5" />
But you said, ‘I will certainly make you prosper and will make your descendants like the sand on the seashore, too numerous to count.’”
Jacob stayed there that night. Then he sent as a gift to his brother Esau

<st data-num="03967" class="">200</st> <st data-num="05795" class="">female goats</st> and <st data-num="06242" class="">20</st> <st data-num="08495" class="">male goats</st>, <st data-num="03967" class="">200</st> <st data-num="07353" class="">ewes</st> and <st data-num="06242" class="">20</st> <st data-num="0352" class="">rams</st>,

<st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="03243" class="">female</st> <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st> with their <st data-num="01121" class="">young</st>, <st data-num="0705" class="">40</st> <st data-num="06510" class="">cows</st> and <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="06499" class="">bulls</st>, and <st data-num="06242" class="">20</st> <st data-num="0860" class="">female donkeys</st> and <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="05895" class="">male donkeys</st>.

He <st data-num="05414" class="">entrusted</st> them <st data-num="03027" class="">to</st><n id="1" /> his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>, who <st data-num="0905" class="">divided</st> them <st data-num="05739" class="">into</st> <st data-num="05739" class="">herds</st>.<n id="2" /> He <st data-num="0559 0413">told</st> his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>, “<st data-num="05674" class="">Pass over</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> me, and <st data-num="07760" class="">keep</st> some <st data-num="07305" class="">distance</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> one <st data-num="05739" class="">herd</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="05739" class="">next</st>.”

He <st data-num="06680 0559">instructed</st> the servant leading the <st data-num="07223" class="">first</st> herd,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="03588" class="">When</st> my <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> <st data-num="06215" class="">Esau</st> <st data-num="06298" class="">meets</st> you and <st data-num="07592 0559">asks</st>, ‘To <st data-num="04310" class="">whom</st> do <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> belong?<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0575" class="">Where</st> are you <st data-num="01980" class="">going</st>? <st data-num="04310" class="">Whose</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">herds</st> are you <st data-num="06440" class="">driving</st>?’<n id="3" />
then you must say, ‘They belong to your servant Jacob. They have been sent as a gift to my lord Esau. In fact Jacob himself is behind us.’”
He also gave these instructions to the second and third servants, as well as all those who were following the herds, saying, “You must say the same thing to Esau when you meet him.

You must <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st>, ‘<st data-num="02009" class="">In fact</st> your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> is <st data-num="0310" class="">behind</st> us.’”<n id="1" /> Jacob <st data-num="03588 0559">thought</st>,<n id="2" /> “I will first <st data-num="03722" class="">appease</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">him</st><n id="3" /> by <st data-num="01980" class="">sending</st> a <st data-num="04503" class="">gift</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">ahead of</st> me.<n id="4" /> <st data-num="0310" class="">After</st> <st data-num="03651" class="">that</st> I will <st data-num="07200" class="">meet</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">him</st>.<n id="5" /> <st data-num="0194" class="">Perhaps</st> he will <st data-num="05375" class="">accept</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">me</st>.”<n id="6" />
So the gifts were sent on ahead of him while he spent that night in the camp.
During the night Jacob quickly took his two wives, his two female servants, and his eleven sons and crossed the ford of the Jabbok.

He <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> them and <st data-num="05674" class="">sent</st> them <st data-num="05674" class="">across</st> the <st data-num="05158" class="">stream</st> <st data-num="05674" class="">along with</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="0834" class="">possessions</st>.<n id="1" />

So <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> was <st data-num="03498" class="">left</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">alone</st>. Then a <st data-num="0582" class="">man</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="079" class="">wrestled</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> him <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="05927 07837">daybreak</st>.<n id="3" />
When the man saw that he could not defeat Jacob, he struck the socket of his hip so the socket of Jacob’s hip was dislocated while he wrestled with him.
Then the man said, “Let me go, for the dawn is breaking.” “I will not let you go,” Jacob replied, “unless you bless me.”

The man <st data-num="0559 0413">asked</st> him,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> is your <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st>?”<n id="2" /> He <st data-num="0559" class="">answered</st>, “<st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st>.”
“No longer will your name be Jacob,” the man told him, “but Israel, because you have fought with God and with men and have prevailed.”
Then Jacob asked, “Please tell me your name.” “Why do you ask my name?” the man replied. Then he blessed Jacob there.
So Jacob named the place Peniel, explaining, “Certainly I have seen God face to face and have survived.”
The sun rose over him as he crossed over Penuel, but he was limping because of his hip.
That is why to this day the Israelites do not eat the sinew which is attached to the socket of the hip, because he struck the socket of Jacob’s hip near the attached sinew.
